articles.title: A gene that may explain why some are asymptomatic - The Indian Express
articles.description: The team led by Newcastle University, UK, has demonstrated that the gene, HLA-DRB1*04:01, is found three times as often in people who are asymptomatic. This suggests that people with this gene have some level of protection from severe Covid.

articles.title: Explained: What is 'long COVID' — how is vaccination expected to affect such patients? - Gaonconnection | Your Connection with Rural India - Gaon Connection English
articles.description: Recovery from COVID19 can be exceptionally delayed in many patients. Some cases even take months to heal completely. A new study explains the link between vaccination and the phenomenon commonly referred to as ‘long COVID’.
